class.name: PLATEAUHeightMapAligner
class.brief_description: Aligns model heights to terrain heightmaps or vice versa.
class.description: PLATEAUHeightMapAligner adjusts building and model heights to match terrain, or adjusts terrain to match roads and other features. [codeblock] var aligner = PLATEAUHeightMapAligner.new() aligner.height_offset = -0.15 # Sink buildings slightly aligner.max_edge_length = 4.0 aligner.add_heightmap(terrain_heightmap_data) var aligned_meshes = aligner.align(building_mesh_array) [/codeblock]

method.name: add_heightmap
method.description: Add a heightmap to use for alignment. Multiple heightmaps can be added for areas with multiple terrain pieces.

method.name: get_heightmap_count
method.description: Returns the number of registered heightmaps.

method.name: align
method.description: Align model heights to the registered heightmaps. Returns array of aligned [PLATEAUMeshData]. [b]Note:[/b] This method is not supported on mobile platforms (Android/iOS/visionOS).

method.name: align_invert
method.description: Align heightmaps to model heights (inverse alignment). Used for aligning terrain to roads. Returns array of updated [PLATEAUHeightMapData]. [b]Note:[/b] This method is not supported on mobile platforms (Android/iOS/visionOS).

method.name: get_height_at
method.description: Get height at a specific XZ position from the heightmaps. Returns NaN if position is outside all heightmaps.

members.member: Height offset when aligning models to terrain. Use small negative values (e.g., -0.15) to sink buildings slightly into terrain.
Maximum edge length for mesh subdivision during alignment. Smaller values = more accurate but slower.
Alpha expand width for inverse alignment.
Alpha averaging width for inverse alignment.
